alert.note: Alert for Brown; Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 2:28AM CDT until May 09 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Northwestern Brown County in north central Nebraska... * Until 300 AM CDT. * At 228 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles east of Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, or 25 miles west of Ainsworth, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Johnstown, Valentine National Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak, Moon Lake and Highway 83 crossing Goose Creek. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 223 and 240. Highway 83 between mile markers 174 and 191. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
